alert.note: Alert for East Central Tularosa Basin, Alamogordo; East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Northern Dona Ana County; Otero Mesa; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Sierra County Lakes; Southeast Tularosa Basin; Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; West Central Tularosa Basin, White Sands; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 29 at 6:41AM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico, including the following areas, Otero, Dona Ana and eastern Sierra Counties and Portions of southwest Texas, El Paso and Hudspeth counties * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
